section.title: Supported Networking Configuration
section.p: Before installing the TinTri driver into your Helion OpenStack deployment, you must ensure that the Helion OpenStack cluster is configured appropriately. The following post-installation networking tasks will help you to configure your deployment for TinTri integration:
section.note:
If TinTri Storage is on a dedicated network, you need to define the network VLAN details in HLM input model files. For more information on how to do this, see the following topics:
Input Model
Example Configurations
section.p:
After completing the post-deployment network configuration, you may want to create an optional network configuration to improve storage input-output performance. The following configuration was tested:
Create an additional virtual local area networks (VLANs) for Storage Management network configuration.
Create an additional VLAN for data traffic.
Ensure that these additional VLANs can pass traffic through all the other Helion OpenStack VLAN networks. For more information on how to complete these steps, refer to the Helion OpenStack Pre-Installation Checklist which covers example configuration models, input model configurations, and network configurations.
